selected_quotes: Domestic violence extends beyond the physical. It's time to tackle economic abuse as well.
The economic abuse of women flies under the radar in our response to domestic violence.
Economic abuse is easy to miss, but it must be part of any response to domestic violence.
Restricting access to resources a form of domestic abuse

citation.abstract: Momentum for reform to end domestic violence should not stop at the most dramatic expressions of abuse. Economic abuse can also contribute to a lifetime of struggle for women.
citation.title: Tackling economic abuse of women must be part of our domestic violence response

news.title: Domestic violence also has an economic penalty – we need to tackle it
news.summary: While Australia has a national conversation on domestic violence, some of the harms of this violence remain in the shadows.

news.title: Domestic violence also has an economic penalty – we need to tackle it
news.summary: by Jane Bullen And Natasha Cortis, The Conversation Australia’s social safety net is not doing nearly enough to counter the economic harms of violence.

news.title: We need to be cautious when assuming CCTV will prevent family violence
